channel.title: C Sharp + XNA
channel.description:
This thread really has no fucking point but I'd just like to say to everyone to give it a go. I started C# earlier today and I've already made a fucking screen recorder (called it 'Viddy' lol). The language is just like Java (seriously took my an hour to figure out everything I needed to know) and with XNA you can make games for Xbox360 (I converted my Java game of Snake to this and ran it on my 360). Using Visual C#, GUI's are easy as hell (even easier than NetBeans GUI designer) and generally speaking, the code conventions are good looking (except I don't like the new line for '{' after the method declaration). Using Mono it's cross-platform too (the only reason I actually tried this was because I got a free developer installation of Win7, but I know Mono works fine).
[url=http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/en-us/products/2010-editions/visual-csharp-express]Visual C# Express (free)[/url] [url=http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=23714]XNA Game Studio (Must have a modern graphics card to use this) (free)[/url]
Even if you're going to stick with Java (I know I am), I highly recommend you try it out (it's fun making stuff for Xbox). The documentation is alright too. I'm going to start making a server in C# (for the lols), too (I would have to re-write the classes involving the cache though (can't steal from Jagex :o). Since it came with C++ Express too, I'd like to say...
[size=24pt]C++ Documentation is shit[/size]

item.title: C Sharp + XNA
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:9, topic:439876”][quote author=_s link=topic=542567.msg3976281#msg3976281 date=1334695791]

i found c++ to be shit only if you use it shit-ily
[/quote]and i found your C++ looked more like C.

oh ps C++'s documentation isn’t shit if you look in the right places.

and using c++ for anything beyond data structures (map/vector etc) and possibly basic objects (which really isn’t necessary) is just plain stupid[/quote]the majority of C++ programmers would crucify your mentality as the fundamental gripe they have is that C with sprinkles is exactly the definition of poor C++ which is apparently there to completely deprecate the flaws of C, therefore writing C with basic usage of C++ features is counterintuitive.

Read full topic

item.title: C Sharp + XNA
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:7, topic:439876”][quote author=_s link=topic=542567.msg3976281#msg3976281 date=1334695791]

i found c++ to be shit only if you use it shit-ily
[/quote]and i found your C++ looked more like C.

oh ps C++'s documentation isn’t shit if you look in the right places

Any recommendations?[/quote]http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/ isnt bad. most developers of libraries do go our of their way to provide good documentation (SFML, OGRE3D are good). also http://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/libstdc++/ is good if you’re working with g++.

finally why do people even bother with these hefty languages, i think the idea of semantical elegance is thrown out of the window when you consider the syntactical mess and inflexibilities of common languages or perhaps i’m just too far into the Lisp trap because i complain about Haskell in the same way

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

dain bramage:

[size=24pt]C++ Documentation is shit[/size]

But yeah, I really fucking love C# and XNA. I’ve been deving C# for about 2 years now and there are a load of things that I love about it. It’s just a shame that it’s portability is a little limited at the moment.

item.description:
